definition: younger generations will do all right on their own (idiom)
pinyin: er2 sun1 zi4 you3 er2 sun1 fu2

definition: younger generations will do all right on their own (idiom)
pinyin: er2 sun1 zi4 you3 er2 sun1 fu2

sentences.english: When the flies, their knee, the sharing of family happiness.
sentences.chinese: 時如梭，兒孫齊膝下，共享天倫樂。

sentences.english: These were the sons of Rachel who were born to Jacob-fourteen in all.
sentences.chinese: 這是拉結給雅各所生的兒孫，共有十四人。

sentences.english: He had lots of children and grandchildren, which for Chinese people is the best luck possible.
sentences.chinese: 他兒孫滿堂，這在中國人看來是最大的福氣。

sentences.english: These are the sons of Rachel, which were born to Jacob: all the souls were fourteen.
sentences.chinese: 這是拉結給雅各所生的兒孫，共有十四人。

sentences.english: Their seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他們眼見兒孫，和他們一同堅立。

sentences.english: After this, Job lived a hundred and forty years; he saw his children and their children to the fourth generation.
sentences.chinese: 此後約伯又活了一百四十年，得見他的兒孫到四代。

sentences.english: These sons and daughters of his were thirty-three in all.

definition: glory, splendor, wealth and rank (idiom); high position and great wealth
the younger generation/those who come after
to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
